dialogues.speaker: narrator
dialogues.text: As the last train passed by, Lan stood at the edge of the platform, clutching an old letter in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: character1
dialogues.text: Every time I come here, I think of that day. The way you left, without a word... Do you even remember what you promised me?

dialogues.speaker: character1
dialogues.text: It's been five years. Five long years of waiting, wondering, hoping for a sign. Just one sign that you still care.

dialogues.speaker: character2
dialogues.text: Lan, I didn't forget. I couldn't come back… not until I made things right. I know I hurt you. I thought staying away would protect you.

dialogues.speaker: character1
dialogues.text: You should've trusted me. I didn't need protection—I needed the truth.

dialogues.speaker: character1
dialogues.text: Didn't you realize that silence hurts more than any truth could?

dialogues.speaker: character2
dialogues.text: You're right. I was a coward. But I'm here now. And if you'll let me… I want to rebuild everything I broke. With you.

dialogues.speaker: character1
dialogues.text: I've waited so long to hear those words. Just… don't make me wait again.

dialogues.speaker: narrator
dialogues.text: The platform lights flickered as they stood face to face—no trains, no noise, just two hearts trying to find their rhythm again.
